Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I decided to have dinner at Pasta Bella on a Tuesday night.  The atmosphere was pleasant.  My son had the basic cheese pizza that he thought was delicious.  We were happy to purchase a Yelp coupon that basically paid for our appetizer and one side salad.  My husband had the Mellanzana Mediterranea and I had the Baked Ziti.  Both dishes were excellent and portions were enough to have for lunch the next day.  This long time Ballard establishment will certainly stand the test of time with great meals and service.

Reviews.Author: YW T.
Reviews.Content: this is definitely one of our favorite italian places. the food is always delicious and perfectly seasoned. i always order the prosciutto wrapped chicken breast with creamy sauteed mushroom and sun dried tomato garlic sauce along with veggies and pasta on the side from their special (it's available as a special most of the time). ok, i just drooled on my keyboard when typing the last sentence... i took one star off because the service hasn't been consistent. sometimes they're really attentive, and sometimes they're just there to hang out with each other.  although i must say that the last time i visited (last week), the service was good.

Reviews.Author: AJ M.
Reviews.Content: Good food, better service.

Reviews.Author: Winnie C.
Reviews.Content: Went there for a girls night out. It was delicious. The waiter treated us well. It was a nice petite Italian restaurant. I would recommend this place.

Reviews.Author: Carrie P.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I eat here frequently.  We love their menu.  There are so many menu choices and anything you get is pretty much guaranteed to be good.  Service is always great and we've never had to wait to be seated.  Menu prices are reasonable.

Reviews.Author: Amber H.
Reviews.Content: I can only rate the food, as I've never actually eaten in the restaurant but it consistently looks busy and the staff is always very helpful and friendly when I pop in to pick up my take-out. They were friendly even before they started to recognize that I was a repeat customer (I order take-out a lot) and it always seemed to me like people were thanking their servers, etc as the left so I'm a bit surprised to hear some of the complaints I've read here. Growing up in NJ, in what I like to refer to as 3 square miles of guido, I was lucky enough to experience quite a bit of true Italian cooking. Everything I've tried from Pasta Bella gets it right. Their dishes are flavorful and don't feel like they're drowning in grease or sauce (yet you still get an ample amount for dipping your bread in). Their homemade ceasar dressing is absolutely amazing, and even with take-out, they include some of their delicious warm bread with roasted garlic. My favorite dish is the Chicken Marsala, which rivals the home cooking of a "straight off the boat" Italian I know.  The only "cons" I can think about regarding Pasta Bella are that they don't deliver (but really, dining at their establishment is their forte so I can't really fault them for that) and they are slightly more expensive than some of the other "Italian" restaurants in the area but in my opinion  you get what you pay for. Sure, Pasta Bella might be a few bucks more (and really, it's not that much more expensive than Palermo or the other "Italian" places in the area who are really glorified pizzerias) but the quality is MUCH higher.

Reviews.Author: Chris R.
Reviews.Content: One of the best Italian restaurants in town. Small but with great atmosphere. Good for groups or a date. Consistently fantastic food and service. You will love this place.

Reviews.Author: Christina L.
Reviews.Content: We went here as a family for the 1st time last night. Restaurant has a cute but worn atmosphere, kind of shabby chic I guess. At first I was a little skeptical as there werent many people in there and no kids (we had our 8 year old and 14 month old.) But as we sat there more people trickled in, with kids in tow as well.Anyhow, on to the food!! I have to say YUM YUM YUM. Delightful that they serve bread with roasted garlic, and you can dip in the olive oil and balsamic vinegar. They dont bring much butter since they have this for you on the table.I had Linguine con pollo piccata, very delish!! Nicely cooked chicken breast with a lemony caper sauce, just the right amount of lemony goodness, that came atop linguine and a side of veggies that included carrots, broccoli, and zucchini which were very nicely seasoned as well. My fiance had Gnocchi but I dont remember what sauce, it was kind of a creamy tomato-y kind of sauce, it was also very good. The gnocchi were nice and fluffy, but a little chewy and good. My daughter had the kids alfredo with chicken and it was delicious as well. The chicken was well seasoned and the sauce was just the right amount of garlicky creaminess, and the noodles were cooked to perfection. We also had the "fried ravioli" for appetizer, which was the only dish that I would say was just "ok." It wasnt the fried ravioli you would get at say, the olive garden. It was not breaded, it was just kind of sauteed so that the pasta part was crispy and then they put a tomato sauce over it, where as im used to having a sauce on the sice to dip it in. Overall the experience was good, and I would definitely return here for some delicious pasta again!!

Reviews.Author: Delairen B.
Reviews.Content: We went here because someone gave us a coupon for buy-one-get-one-free entree, and it seemed like it could be good. They were able to seat us quickly and without a reservation, which was nice. They served us complimentary bread and... roasted garlic YUM. The roasted garlic was almost enough to earn this place an additional star. It was that good. Unfortunately, it was probably also the best part of the meal. We ordered the small caesar salad, the gnocchi appetizer, the lasagna and the pollo parmagiana. The salad was fine. Unremarkable, but okay. So hubby and I came down split on the Gnocchi though. He liked it. I thought it was a little too mushy. (I prefer a slightly firmer gnocchi). The sauce was pretty tasty however, and this dish was probably my favorite after the bread.The Lasagna, was okay, but also unremarkable. The Pollo Parmagiana was a mix. The Pollo part was yummy, can't really go wrong with breaded and fried chicken, lol. But the pasta was overcooked and again, the sauce was unremarkable. It was served with a side of veggies that was pretty good though. Overall, with the coupon, I'd say it was worth the price. But I wouldn't go back and pay full price for what we received. In fact, there wasn't really anything I'd go back for, except the bread and garlic, and honestly, I can easily do that at home so... yeah, not really baaaaad... but not great either.

Reviews.Author: Lorena D.
Reviews.Content: This is my preferred place to get Italian. I can't count how many times I've eaten here with various friends, and I think everyone has enjoyed it. The staff are very friendly and welcoming, the restaurant is cozy, and while the food isn't phenomenal, the menu offers good variety and most of it is really consistently good. I never worry that I'll be disappointed if I order something new. And I love the roasted garlic and oil and vinegar they offer with the bread basket. We're always too full to eat dessert there, but they're very good about packing up any leftovers for us, as well as dessert to go. They even do a good job with large groups, something I think most Seattle restaurants don't handle very well.

Reviews.Author: Kate W.
Reviews.Content: I was recently here with a group of 7 other women -- we had to wait 20 min for our table, despite a reservation made a week in advance (it was the other table's fault for taking too long ... according to the waiter). The service was incredibly slow - from the waiter bordering on inattentive, to having to ask for water refills, to it taking almost 2 hours to get our entrees. (Our reservation was at 815, we sat down ~ 835, we didn't get entrees until 955). To the waiter's credit, we were a group of 8 women and were talking - but still, the timing between our orders, our salads and our entrees was extremely long.The saving grace was the food - which was delicious. Amazing pasta, cooked just perfectly and lovely flavor combinations.I wouldn't go back right away, as there are so many options in Seattle, but know its a go-to option for Italian cuisine. I would probably not return with a big group.

Reviews.Author: Matt M.
Reviews.Content: Consistently great since the mid-90s!My wife and I came here a few times when we lived in Magnolia back in the mid-90s and always enjoyed it. The food and the service were great. Imagine our pleasant surprise when we noticed it was still in business all these years later when we drove by while visiting Seattle with our teenage kids this July! We just had to eat there again. I am happy to report that nothing has changed in 15 years!

Reviews.Author: Randall L.
Reviews.Content: Not bad for what I call and old school italian-american pasta house.  I didn't care for the anti pasto plate but my pasta was acceptable.

Reviews.Author: Brian C.
Reviews.Content: I ordered take out from pasta bella tonight, and while they were very nice to honor my coupon that was supposed to be for dine in only, my raviolis were extremely salty.  I'm sure it's a very nice place and other dishes are good (my tiramasu was tasty, and the bread was nice) but I was in the mood to seriously mow down some Italian food.  I could hardly swallow that last bite.

Reviews.Author: Jill T.
Reviews.Content: I would usually only give this restaurant 3 stars.  It is really good, but I can get the same type of Italian food at a lot of other restaurants.I will tell you thought, what makes this a 4 star restaurant is the DELICIOUS roasted garlic served with the bread.  It is so delicious I think I could eat it everyday.

Reviews.Author: Cindy T.
Reviews.Content: We took our friend to Pasta Bella in Ballard for dinner.  We had never been there before and it's our new favorite.  The atmosphere is romantic, cozy and comfortable all at the same time.  The food was delicious.  I had the halibut picata special and it melted in my mouth - it was the most perfectly cooked halibut I've ever had.  And the service was outstanding too - friendly, attentive, and genuine.Thank you for a terrific evening! We'll be back soon. Cindy

Reviews.Author: Pamela C.
Reviews.Content: My favorite restaurant!

Reviews.Author: Jan M.
Reviews.Content: Love the Food. Love the Service. Wish my Ravioli was hot, though:(

Reviews.Author: Mark T.
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Pasta Bella since before my eldest daughter was born and tonight we celebrated her high school graduation there. Consistency has been a major reason for our loyalty. Sure, there is better Italian food in Seattle,and even in Ballard, but Pasta Bella has always provided a satisfying and tasty meal at a decent price. Best to order from the specials, but even the base menu has a nice list of choices, from standard Italian fare to more interesting flavor combinations. As for service, they seem to have higher staff turnover even than most restaurants, so you never know who you will get. But we have been generally pleased with the wait staff. We will certainly will continue to return.

Reviews.Author: Kara M.
Reviews.Content: Host seemed incredibly new and inexperienced, wait staff did well but lacked the smooth polish of a real professional job. Food was quite good...atmosphere was a little odd. Also, it was cold, the tables and booths weren't up to my standards, and the noise echoed terribly. But the food (usually the focus!) was very good.

Reviews.Author: Gretchen G.
Reviews.Content: I went here for my birthday dinner. It was gross. I had the chicken Parmesan and it tasted like the chicken was freezer burnt.  Not the best. This was my second trip to Pasta Bella and I think they are one step away from being featured on Food Networks Restaurant Impossible. Clearly they need to rethink their current kitchen staff. Save your money fellow pasta seekers Olive Garden deserves ten stars compared to this Italian train wreck!

Reviews.Author: Elias L.
Reviews.Content: Best pasta I have ever had in my life! The special was goat cheese ravioli with a garlic cream sauce...AMAZING! Server (Jesse) was perfect! suggestions were spot on. Ever the server assistants were pleasant and personable. Will definitely be going back! Date night perfection!

Reviews.Author: L S.
Reviews.Content: Pasta Bella has some delicious food. Erik T and I came here a few weeks ago when we didn't know what to have for dinner one night. Driving around Ballard, I had a genius idea! Let's have something GOOD for dinner! Let's go to Pasta Bella! I had previously only dined at the Queen Anne location a couple of years ago with my mom. I didn't think much had changed or that anything would be any different at the Ballard location of this fine Italian restaurant. I was right. The food was great! We enjoyed the complimentary (and delicious!) roasted garlic before our meals were brought to us. I then devoured my entire meal of Linguini Carbonara and Erik made a decent dent in his Spaghetti Bolognese.  My meal was really superb, and Erik later mentioned he kinda wished he had ordered something a little more adventurous than spaghetti. I had a glass of the house chianti, my usual when I go out for Italian. And it always tastes good. Erik ordered a Blueberry Italian soda. It was so good! We contemplated dessert, but since I had finished my entire meal, I was pretty full and Erik was pretty full, so we declined, though all the dessert options sounded delish. For the meal we had and the dining experience we had, I felt the prices were fair. My dish was $13.95 and Erik's spaghetti was $11.95. The portions were large, Erik had a delightful lunch of leftovers the next day. Erik's Italian soda was reasonably priced at $2.95 and my glass of wine was a deal at $4.95. Erik and I decided that when we go back, we'll probably just get a half carafe of wine, a good deal for $12. Erik and I will definitely return to Pasta Bella, not only because of it's close proximity to our home, but because the food was really good! The restaurant itself is cozy and eclectically decorated. Pasta Bella is a must if you live in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Author: Cat L.
Reviews.Content: I thought the food here was delicious! I am very picky when it comes to Italian food, but I loved everything we ate at this restaurant. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because of the atmosphere (We went to the one on Queen Anne). There's nothing terribly wrong with it, but the decorations and location is a little strange. The servers were prompt, but not very friendly. It felt like they were relatives of the owners helping out, rather than real servers. The food make it all worth while though!

Reviews.Author: Luisa I.
Reviews.Content: I really thought Pasta Bella would be our new "go to" place for Italian food. The place looks so cozy, they seem to have a lot of regular customers, and usually little hole in the wall places turn out to be gems. Unfortunately every part of our experience there was negative. My soup was room temperature, which was a disappointment since I had a cold and was really looking forward to a steamy bowl of soup. My husband ordered lasagne, and it was still chilled in the center. The worst part is when we told the waitress, she was so rude. She rolled her eyes at us and didn't even apologize. When she came back with the re-heated lasagne, it still was cold. I would have given a higher rating if the staff was at least nice about it, but our complaints of the cold food seemed to be a nusissance to them. Also, I wanted to mention that this happened about a year ago and it's been on my mind since...hopefully they've gotten better.

Reviews.Author: Joey G.
Reviews.Content: Excellent food! great prices! Just open menu and point everything is good!

Reviews.Author: Mac J.
Reviews.Content: chicken pesto con penne!

Reviews.Author: erik b.
Reviews.Content: the first time i went here, i had found the best itallian restaurant in seattle. everything was perfect: food, service, atmosphere. everything. was. perfect. the second time however, it was terrible. the seating was right next to the bathroom, even though there were plenty of available tables. the place was not busy however, the service was extremely slow. i think it was about twenty minutes from when we were seated until the time we ordered. when we received our food, mine was not what i ordered.  after waiting for the server for a while, i told her about my order. she really made no effort to remedy the situation. so at this point, i was just really hungry and tired, and told her not to worry about it.  i ate what i did not order, and when we were finished, the server just gave us the check. no offer of dessert, drinks, or coffee.  so, i'm up in the air about this place. i will give it another chance, but i don't know when that will be. hopefully my third time will be as great as my first time was.

Reviews.Author: Leslie S.
Reviews.Content: Leslie S.  My companion had angel hair with chicken and fresh vegetables while I tried the manicotti stuffed with crab.  Both were absolutely delicious.  Bread was hot, roasted garlic soft, merlot pleasing.  The staff was attentive and observant, and the chef came to the table to see how we liked our meals.   This was my first time at the restaurant; I would definitely return, often.
